extendedInfo.description: MovieBell Maker, almost all media files convert mp3 file format.Converted MP3 is available as ringtone(also notification, alarm).Support formats :avi, asf, mov, mpg, mpeg, wmv, wmf, wav, swf,  wma, mp4 , mp3, ogg, rm, rmvb, mp2, cda, flac, aac, ac3, 3gp, mkv etc...- Features 1. Convert video files to MP3 format by the interval you want. 2. Edit MP3 files. (MP3 converted is stored in /sdcard/MovieBell/Mp3/..) 3. Ring(kakaotalk, ringtone, notification, alarm) Settings. 4. Voice Recording. 5. ScreenShot. 6. Adjusting white balance.- Usage 1. Set the start time. 2. Set the end time. 3. Click the Save button to convert it to MP3. 4. To edit. 5. Ring setting.keyword : MovieBellMaker, Movie Bell Maker, VitalPlayer, ringdroid, Moviebell, ringtone, notification

reviews.title: Crashes every time
reviews.comment: I select the part of my wma song that I want to make into a sound and click save. The app then has a popup which says, \"would you like to edit sound?\" Click ok then the app just goes to a black screen then closes leaving me with no sound.
reviews.author: Roberto Ford

reviews.title: GREAT!!
reviews.comment: Just so good! So easy and simple, so neat and useful, so much to the point and exactly what I want!!!!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: THIS APP ROCKS!!
reviews.comment: So easy and simple! Thank you developers! Took my windows media files and ~snap~had my ringtones back up and running for my contacts!
reviews.author: TnA Stuart-Smolik

reviews.title: Good but seriously flawed.
reviews.comment: Great for making ringtones, but I can\'t delete them once they\'re made. Please fix this issue!

reviews.title: Doesn\342\200\231t work as described
reviews.comment: I have an ogg file that I need to shorten. Despite the fact the description states that it is compatible with ogg files. I open the file in this app and it suddenly closes. Don\'t waste your time.
reviews.author: Barbara Gordon

reviews.title: Finallyyyy!!!!!!
reviews.comment: I went through so many different apps to make my own ringtones from my music on my phone. This is the only one that takes wma files. It took me a second to figure out how to use it. But I got it down. Thank you!!! I love it.
reviews.author: A Google User
